p: The SARS (Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome) epidemic caused by the SARS-CoV virus, originated in November 2002, through the interspecies transmission of wildlife markets in Guangdong Province, southeastern China. In the months following the primary infection until its end in August 2003, there were 8422 people infected in 26 countries, leading to 916 deaths (10.87 %). These numbers are not on the scale of major epidemics, such as seasonal forms of influenza or 2019-nCoV, but in an era of rapid globalization, the potential for a pandemic was significant [ 13].
